page.title: 01Introduction to our region.
page.content: { It consists of a semi_rural,commuter {dormitory which has recently {suffered severe unemployment {problems with the closure of the {Consett Steel Works.A new industrial {estate has brought some new industry {to the area including {micro-technology,but has done little {to reduce unemployment which remains {a major social issue.(April-7788)} Shotley Bridge{General Hospital is {the greatest employer as is {H.M.Detention Centre in Medomsley,as {well as farming and forestry.The {reclaimed coal mining land has {caused subsidence in Medomsley. {The river Derwent marks the County {boundry between Durham and {Northumberland.Medomsley 260m high {provides magnificent views across {the Derwent valley and down to Shotley {80m on the valley floor.. }
